abstract: A push to keep spending in check runs against President Obama’s call for Europe not to withdraw economic stimulus too hastily.
snippet: A push to keep spending in check runs against President Obama’s call for Europe not to withdraw economic stimulus too hastily.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT  European countries need to keep a sharper eye on one another’s finances, and sanctions against fiscal rule-breakers should kick in automatically, the European Central Bank president, Jean-Claude Trichet, said on Monday.

headline.main: Despite Obama’s Plea, European Bank Renews Call for Austerity
headline.print_headline: Despite Obama’s Plea, European Bank Renews Call for Austerity
